snippet: President Obama had asked for the Internal Revenue Service’s budget to be increased by more than $1 billion, but Congress trimmed the agency’s funds last month.
abstract: Internal report says an expanding workload and cuts in funds have left the Internal Revenue Service unable to adequately perform collecting billions of dollars in taxes and provide the public with reasonable service.
lead_paragraph: President Obama had asked for the Internal Revenue Service’s budget to be increased by more than $1 billion, but Congress trimmed the agency’s funds last month.

headline.seo: Budget Cuts Hamper I.R.S. From Performing Its Duties, Report Says
headline.main: Budget Cuts Hamper the I.R.S. in Efforts to Collect Billions in Taxes, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Budget Cuts Hamper the I.R.S. in Efforts to Collect Billions in Taxes, Report Says
